intro: Cyrtandra oenobarba var. petiolaris, commonly known as the Hawaiian petioled cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent petioles, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
